title: QAnon
added: Other Qanon affiliated protestors either wore clothing with the Q emblem or were identified as known followers of the conspiracy theory from video footage.<ref>{{cite news|last=Culbertson|first=Alix|url=https://news.sky.com/story/us-capitol-from-neo-nazis-and-conspiracy-theorists-to-a-politician-who-stormed-the-capitol-12181628|title=US Capitol: Q-Anon, Confederate flag man, and Baked Alaska - here are the people who stormed the building|work=Sky News|date=8 January 2021|access-date=January 8, 2021}}<M/ref>

title: QAnon
deleted: ===Attempts by Q to explain false claims and failed predictions===

title: QAnon
added: Suggestions for making progress responding to QAnon and reducing its impact on society include actions for individuals on social media and the social media platform companies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/13/technology/qanon-internet-companies.html}}</ref>
The subreddits r/QAnonCasualties and r/ReQovery help people dealing with QAnon.<ref name=vox201118/>

Trying to talk someone out of conspiracy theory beliefs is that they generally alienate the believer, driving them more deeply into the conspiracy.  Empathy is recommended with a believer, and sometimes it helps to discuss the ways misinformation commonly spreads.<ref name=vox201118/>

An online game has been developed that helps players understand how misinformation spreads, in part because research shows that people who understand those mechanisms are less likely to be hooked themselves, although [https://www.goviralgame.com/en ''Go Viral!''] was developed specifically for COVID-19 misinformation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2020-10/uoc-gc100920.php}}</ref><ref name=vox201118/>

title: QAnon
added: Following the [[inauguration of Joe Biden]], which many proponents of QAnon had claimed to be either illegitimate, or apart of Trump's plan, it is not clear where the future of the theory lies. Several researchers have predicted that Biden's presidency could lead to the disillusionment of many adherents to the theory, although there would always be a group of strong devotees to it, who are likely to 'follow Trump into either a kind of movement-in-exile or a more militant insurrectionist force.'<ref>{{Cite web|last=EST|first=Jacob Jarvis On 1/19/21 at 11:52 AM|date=2021-01-19|title=Joe Biden inauguration is reality check that QAnon zealots will refuse|url=https://www.newsweek.com/joe-biden-inauguration-qanon-reality-check-1562624|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Newsweek|language=en}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: === Interruption of Ghislaine Maxwell court hearing ===

On January 19, 2021, a hearing of the unsealing of documents related to a settled [[Ghislaine Maxwell]] civil defamation suit with [[Virginia Roberts Giuffre]] was interrupted after it was discovered that someone present was unlawfully streaming the proceedings to Youtube. The unauthorized stream reached a peak of approximately 14,000 viewers before it was shut off following the judge's warning to the room.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-01-19|title=Ghislaine Maxwell court hearing disrupted by apparent QAnon followers|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/19/ghislaine-maxwell-court-proceeding-qanon|access-date=2021-01-20|website=the Guardian|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Hodjat|first=Arya|date=2021-01-19|title=QAnon Loyalists Cause Chaos During Ghislaine Maxwell Hearing|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/hearing-on-release-of-sealed-ghislaine-maxwell-court-docs-interrupted-by-qanon-cultists|access-date=2021-01-20|website=The Daily Beast|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=|first=|date=|title=|work=|url=https://www.miamiherald.com/news/state/florida/article248600605.html|url-status=live|access-date=}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: On January 19, 2021, a hearing of the unsealing of documents related to a settled [[Ghislaine Maxwell]] civil defamation suit with [[Virginia Roberts Giuffre]] was interrupted after it was discovered that someone present was unlawfully streaming the proceedings to Youtube. The unauthorized stream reached a peak of approximately 14,000 viewers, including a contingent of QAnon supporters,before it was shut off following the judge's warning to the room.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-01-19|title=Ghislaine Maxwell court hearing disrupted by apparent QAnon followers|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/19/ghislaine-maxwell-court-proceeding-qanon|access-date=2021-01-20|website=TheGuardian|language=en|first=Victoria |last=Bekiempis}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Hodjat|first=Arya|date=2021-01-19|title=QAnon Loyalists Cause Chaos During Ghislaine Maxwell Hearing|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/hearing-on-release-of-sealed-ghislaine-maxwell-court-docs-interrupted-by-qanon-cultists|access-date=2021-01-20|website=The Daily Beast|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|date=January 19, 2021|title=Judge orders release of more Ghislaine Maxwell records — minus salacious details|work=Miami Herald|url=https://www.miamiherald.com/news/state/florida/article248600605.html|url-status=live|access-date=January 21, 2021 |first1=Kevin G. |last1=Hall |first2=Ben |last2=Wieder |first3=Julie K. |last3=Brown}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: In mid-May 2020, Google removed three other apps - QMAP, Q Alerts! and Q Alerts LITE - from the Android app store for violating terms.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Kaplan|first=Alex|date=2020-05-21|title=After months of inaction, Google has finally removed QAnon apps that violated terms of service from its store|url=https://www.mediamatters.org/qanon-conspiracy-theory/after-months-inaction-google-has-finally-removed-qanon-apps-violated-terms|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-15|website=Media Matters for America|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Nieva|first=Richard|date=2020-05-21|title=Google removes QAnon apps from Play Store for violating terms|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/google-removes-qanon-apps-from-play-store-for-violating-terms/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-15|website=CNET|language=en}}</ref>

title: QAnon
deleted: While QAnon was initially promoted by [[Alex Jones]] and [[Jerome Corsi]],<ref name="newsweek" /> [[Right Wing Watch]] reported that they had both ceased to support QAnon by May 2018, declaring the source "completely compromised".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Mantyla |first=Kyle |date=May 11, 2018 |title=Stick A Fork In QAnon: Alex Jones And Jerome Corsi Claim That QAnon Has Been 'Completely Compromised' |url=http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/stick-a-fork-in-qanon-alex-jones-and-jerome-corsi-claim-that-qanon-has-been-completely-compromised/ |access-date=July 5, 2018 |website=Right Wing Watch |language=en-US}}</ref> But in August 2018, Corsi reversed course and said he "will comment on and follow QAnon when QAnon is bringing forth news", adding that "in the last few days, QAnon has been particularly good".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Holt |first=Jared |date=August 17, 2018 |title=Jerome Corsi Wants To Make Amends With QAnon |url=http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/jerome-corsi-wants-to-make-amends-with-qanon/ |access-date=August 19, 2018 |website=Right Wing Watch |language=en-US}}</ref>

title: QAnon
added: [[Pastel QAnon]] is a collection of techniques aimed at [[Indoctrination|indoctrinating]] predominantly women into the conspiracy theory, mainly on social media sites like [[Instagram]], [[Facebook]], WhatsApp, Telegram and [[TikTok]].<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|last=Dickson|first=E. J.|last2=Dickson|first2=E. J.|date=2020-12-14|title='Pastel QAnon' Is Infiltrating the Natural Parenting Community|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/qanon-pastel-antivax-natural-parenting-community-freebirth-1098518/|access-date=2021-03-14|website=Rolling Stone|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite web|date=2021-02-24|title=How the wellness and influencer crowd serve conspiracies to the masses|url=http://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2021/feb/25/how-the-wellness-and-influencer-crowd-served-conspiracies-to-the-masses|access-date=2021-03-14|website=the Guardian|language=en}}</ref> It co-opts the feminine-coded aesthetic (including a pastel colour pallete, which is where it gets its name from) and language of activities and communities popular with women and uses gateway messaging to frame the conspiracies as reasonable concerns.<ref name=":0">{{Citation|title=Meet The White Women Empowering QAnon Part 1|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9YRQaIUNHY|language=en|access-date=2021-03-14}}</ref><ref name=":2" /> The trend was identified by researcher Marc-André Argentino. a researcher at Concordia University, Canada.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|last=Haubursin|first=Christophe|date=2020-10-28|title=The Instagram aesthetic that made QAnon mainstream|url=https://www.vox.com/videos/2020/10/28/21538763/save-the-children-qanon-instagram|access-date=2021-03-14|website=Vox|language=en}}</ref>
